title: "Then Bud Said to Barry, Who Told Bob. . .": The Best Oklahoma Sooners Stories Ever Told (Best Sports Stories Ever Told)
features: Here is your chance to go inside the huddle, head into the locker room, or grab a seat on the sidelines. This is your exclusive pass to get on the team plane or have breakfast at the team hotel. Go behind the scenes and peek into the private world of the players, coaches, and decision makers and eavesdrop on their conversations.
description: "I thought I knew a lot about football until I met Bud [Wilkinson]. It was like going to school with the greatest professor in the world." --OU quarterback Jimmie Harris
"I guarantee you that I am a fighter, I am a competitor, and I am a winner--and you will be, too!" --Barry Switzer, from his first speech as OU head coach
"We knew [Bob Stoops] was for real. He was all business. There was no more playing around. We were going to do great things and we had to buy into what he was telling us." --OU safety Roy Williams
--This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title.
is an author and aÂ freelance writer who has written about college football for more than 25 years. He lives in West Palm Beach, Florida.

author: {'avatar': 'https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/31uWNM3l4BL._SY600_.jpg', 'name': 'Jeff Snook', 'about': ['JEFF SNOOK, a 1982 graduate of The Ohio State University\'s School of Journalism, has written 11 books on college football. His latest book, released in September, 2013, is a collaboration with Virginia Tech Coach Frank Beamer on Let Me Be Frank: My Life at Virginia Tech. Snook also collaborated with Art Schlichter on Schlichter\'s autobiography: "Busted". Schlichter, the last player to be suspended by the NFL for gambling, recently was sentenced to 11 years in federal prison for a series of crimes. Snook has written four books related to Ohio State football and others on the Oklahoma Sooners, Nebraska Cornhuskers and Florida Gators. A native of Ashland, Ohio, he resides in Lantana, Florida.']}
